str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
From philos and hippos; fond of horses; Philippus, the name of four Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To run to. From pros and trecho; to run towards, i.e. Hasten to meet or join.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To read, know again, know certainly, recognize, discern. From ana and ginosko; to know again, i.e. to read.
Isaiah, the prophet. Of Hebrew origin; Hesaias, an Israelite.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.

Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To read, know again, know certainly, recognize, discern. From ana and ginosko; to know again, i.e. to read.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
